newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares end slightly off, tracking the Dow.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares end slightly off, tracking the Dow.

text.p: Brazilian shares ended 0.35 percent lower in moderate turnover, once again influenced by weakness on Wall Street, brokers said.
The Bovespa index of the 49 most traded stocks closed at 64,896 points. Volume was 383.5 million reais ($376.2 million).
Analysts said the local market should continue moving sideways until the U.S. Federal Reserve's policy-setting arm meets on Tuesday to discuss interest rate policy.
Benchmark Telebras preferred fell 0.25 percent to end at 79.90 reais.
The Sao Paulo bourse's power sector index (IEE), comprising the nine most liquid stocks of the sector, fell 0.1 percent, closing at 1,619 points.
Preferred shares of Brazilian private bank BCN rose 0.6 percent to close at 7.80 reais, while its common shares gained 5.88 percent to nine reais.
Although the two parties officially deny any deal, BCN has been subject of speculation that the bank will merge or be sold to BBA Creditanstalt.
